dmca.title: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Trademark/Copyright Material]
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, April 27, 2005 1:20 AM
To: Copyright Compliance
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Trademark/Copyright Material]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

For your review.
- --
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html


- -------- Original Message --------
From:         - Wed Apr 27 01:18:42 2005
X-Mozilla-Status:         0001
X-Mozilla-Status2:         00000000

From:         Christopher Gonzalez, General Counsel <legal@ipowerweb.com>

<abuse@ipowerweb2.com>
Date:         Tue, 26 Apr 2005 17:04:10 -0700
Organization:         iPowerWeb, Inc.
Message-ID:
<!~!UENERkVCMDkAAQACAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAABgAAAAAAAAA2hwbZdIeWE2T2n4SvXuUa8KAAAAQ
AAAAcquf998I/kGAc7EazYSqkAEAAAAA@ipowerweb.com>

boundary="----=_NextPart_000_011B_01C54A82.01F710E0"

X-Spam-Level:         ---------------------------------------------------
X-Spam-Score:         -98.2
Cc:         bwallender@tehplanet.com, eve1@cableone.net, abuse@theplanet.com
Subject:         [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Trademark/Copyright Material
X-BeenThere:         abuse@lists.theplanet.com
X-Mailman-Version:         2.1.5
Precedence:         list
Reply-To:         legal@ipowerweb.com
List-Id:         abuse.lists.theplanet.com
List-Unsubscribe:         <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=unsubscribe>
List-Post:         <mailto:abuse@lists.theplanet.com>
List-Help:         <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=help>
List-Subscribe:         <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=subscribe>
Sender:         abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
Errors-To:         abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
X-Spam-Level:         ---------------------------------------------------
X-Spam-Score:         -98.2



Dear Madam/Sir:



Please be advised that the undersigned serves as General Counsel to and this
office represents IPOWERWEB, INC. (?IPOWERWEB?).  IPOWERWEB owns the rights
to use the trademarks/service marks/trade names and copyrights of the name
IPOWERWEB or derivative thereof.  Please direct all future inquiries and
correspondence to the undersigned only.



It has come to our client's attention that you and/or your business has
participated in and caused or authorized the making and distribution of
certain derivative trademarks/service marks/trade names, copyrighted pages
or portions owned or controlled or created solely by our client, and
knowingly permitted and encouraged the downloading of such copies and
portions with respect to several pages on the Internet/World Wide Web (i.e.,
IPOWERWEB2).  Your company has not obtained authority from IPOWERWEB to use
any of its trademarks/service marks/trade names and copyrighted materials or
derivatives thereof and is in violation of the law.



Our client's trademarks/service marks, trade name and copyrighted materials
were created solely by our client and are protected by copyright and
trademark laws.  Your use of our client?s trademarks/service marks, trade
name directly violates the law.



Your company should have no desire to confuse existing or potential patrons
as to the source, origin, and quality of services or to trade upon the
goodwill of our client.  However, you must be aware that your use of our
client's trademarks/service marks, trade name and copyrighted materials are
likely to cause and has caused confusion or deception or mistake, or a
combination thereof among patrons.



Our client believes that your continued use of its trademarks/service marks,
trade name and copyrighted materials in connection with your business will
result and has resulted in the dilution and loss of our client's goodwill,
thereby violating enforceable copyright rights acquired by our client.



Based upon the nature and extent of your duplication of our client's
trademarks/service marks, trade name and copyrighted materials, my client
can only conclude that it was your intention to deliberately violate the
rights of our client.



Accordingly, in order to protect our client's rights, IPOWERWEB hereby
demands that you immediately cease and desist from any and all further
duplication or use of the its trademarks/service marks, trade name and
copyrighted materials or any derivative trade name or marks thereof,
copyrighted materials and all other unlicensed and infringing activities in
connection with your business conducted on the Internet/World Wide Web.



At this time and for purposes of settlement only, our client demands written
assurance that you will stop all infringing activities.
Accordingly, we suggest that you promptly contact my office upon receipt of
this letter to confirm that the violations will stop.  If you provide
written assurance that you will not continue to use the trademark/service
mark/trade name or any confusingly similar mark or name or any copyrighted
materials, and remove the infringing materials from your website, my client
will consider matter closed.  However, if the violations do not cease we
will have no other alternative but to seek any and all legal remedies
available, including seeking injunctive relief and attorneys fees.



Please respond to this letter immediately.



We also advise you that this letter is written without prejudice to all the
rights and remedies our client may have at law or in equity, all being
hereby reserved on its behalf.



Most seriously,



Christopher Gonzalez

General Counsel

IPOWERWEB, INC.



********************************************

Disclaimer:



This email message, its contents and any attachments hereto, are for the
sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and
privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or
distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please
contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original
message.



Notwithstanding the Uniform Electronic Transactions Act or the applicability
of any other law of similar substance or effect, absent an express statement
to the contrary hereinabove, this e-mail communication, its contents and any
attachments hereto, are not intended to represent an offer or acceptance to
enter into a contract and are not otherwise intended to bind the sender, any
of its clients, or any other person or entity.

********************************************
